title: CKD-EPI 2021 - Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate
description: CKD-EPI 2021 equation to estimate glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) based on serum creatinine, age, and sex. This 2021 version removed the race component from the original equation.

ranges.interpretation: Normal or high GFR. Investigate presence of kidney damage to determine if CKD is present.
Mild decrease in GFR. Investigate presence of kidney damage to determine if CKD is present.

ranges.description: Mild to moderate decrease in GFR
ranges.interpretation: Stage 3a Chronic Kidney Disease. Nephrology follow-up recommended.

ranges.description: Moderate to severe decrease in GFR
ranges.interpretation: Stage 3b Chronic Kidney Disease. Nephrologist referral necessary.
Stage 4 Chronic Kidney Disease. Specialized nephrology follow-up and preparation for kidney replacement therapy.
Stage 5 Chronic Kidney Disease (kidney failure). Kidney replacement therapy (dialysis or transplant) is necessary.

references: Inker LA, Eneanya ND, Coresh J, et al. New creatinine- and cystatin C-based equations to estimate GFR without race. N Engl J Med. 2021;385(19):1737-1749.
National Kidney Foundation. CKD-EPI Creatinine Equation (2021). https://www.kidney.org/ckd-epi-creatinine-equation-2021-0
notes: Equation valid only for adults (≥18 years)
